subject: Technology
title: Longevity Research: Can We Stop Aging?
description: A fast breakdown of Longevity Research: Can We Stop Aging? for builders.

hook.text: Aging kills more people than any disease. Some scientists believe it can be treated like one.

buildup.text: Aging is driven by cellular damage: telomere shortening, DNA mutations, protein buildup, and mitochondrial decline.

discovery.text: Scientists have reversed aging in mice by reprogramming their cells to a younger state using Yamanaka factors.

twist.text: If the treatment goes too far, cells revert to stem cells and can form tumors. The line between rejuvenation and cancer is thin.

climax.text: Billions of dollars now flow into longevity research. The promise isn't immortality but extending healthy years of life.

punchline.text: We may not stop aging. But we might slow it enough to matter.

quiz.question: How have scientists reversed aging in mice?
options: By giving them a special diet
By reprogramming their cells to a younger state using Yamanaka factors
By replacing their organs with artificial ones
